abstract: The financier Leon D. Black and his wife, Debra, formed an organization to help raise money to fight skin cancer after she was successfully treated for the disease.
snippet: The financier Leon D. Black and his wife, Debra, formed an organization to help raise money to fight skin cancer after she was successfully treated for the disease.
lead_paragraph: It was a “real wake-up call,” recalled the billionaire financier Leon D. Black, when his wife, Debra, received a diagnosis of melanoma in 2007.

headline.main: With Wall Street Support, a Charity Grows Up

abstract: California’s top law enforcement official accused JPMorgan Chase on Thursday of flooding the state’s courts with questionable lawsuits to collect a glut of overdue credit card debt.
snippet: California’s top law enforcement official accused JPMorgan Chase on Thursday of flooding the state’s courts with questionable lawsuits to collect a glut of overdue credit card debt.
lead_paragraph: California’s top law enforcement official accused JPMorgan Chase on Thursday of flooding the state’s courts with questionable lawsuits to collect overdue credit card debt.

headline.main: California Sues JPMorgan Chase Over Credit Card Cases
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Sued Over Credit Card Debt Cases

abstract: Gary D. Cohn, the president and chief operating officer of Goldman Sachs, said Wall Street still faced a challenge in explaining its role in the lives of everyday people.
snippet: Gary D. Cohn, the president and chief operating officer of Goldman Sachs, said Wall Street still faced a challenge in explaining its role in the lives of everyday people.
lead_paragraph: Gary D. Cohn, the president and chief operating officer of Goldman Sachs, was sitting on stage at a conference in Manhattan on Thursday when the speaker introducing him cracked a joke.
